p: In antibacterial property of medicinal plants from Nigeria, A. occidentale hydroethanolic extracts (leaf/bark) showed positive effects against Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Enterobacter species, Streptococcus pneumoniae, Corynebacterium pyogenes, Enterococcus faecalis, multiresistant S. aureus, Acinetobacter species, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and multiresistant P. aeruginosa during cavity diffusion tests with inhibition halos varying from 6 to 14 mm ( 18).
